Description: Glazed composition shabti with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with a plaited beard, crossed hands in relief holding an adze, a hoe and the string of the incised seed-basket which hangs over the shoulder, the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of incised Hieroglyphs(now illegible); there is a back-pillar and a plinth beneath the feet.
Curator's comments: Sir Hans Sloane’s ‘Miscellanea’ catalogue is a bound volume in Central Archives containing seven separate catalogues: ‘Miscellanies’, ‘Antiquities’, ‘Seals’, ‘Pictures’, ‘Mathematical Instruments’, ‘Agate Handles’ and ‘Agate Cups, Bottles, Spoons’. Each contains numbered entries that list and describe objects collected by Sloane between the 1680s and 1750s. Each catalogue begins with object number one. Text from Sloane Miscellanea catalogue: Miscellanea Antiquities 279 "279. The same."; the same referring to Miscellanea Antiquities 273 "273. A very large Ægyptian idol in blew clay figlina idola varieæ magnitudinis reperta in mummiarum ventre consuta." and to "277. The same. without hieroglyphicks"
